for_sales.sales_text:
Wheezy Anna is one of a few Mersea `winklebrigs’, which was worked and later restored for racing with the MFOBs. Built in 1925 by Kidby’s of Brightlingsea for Jack Mole, she featured in John Leather’s book `The Salty Shore’ which explains how she got her name.

She passed to the Clarke family, and was working up until the early 1960’s. She was first restored by Peter Clarke, and then again in 2004 by Gerard Swift.

A lovely brig to sail and race, approx. LOA. 15’00

boat.full_description:
In 1925 Jack Mole placed an order with Charles Kidby for a new 15ft Bumkin. She was built complete for £27.10s.0p. Jack had not thought of a name but at the insistence of a young nephew he called her Wheezy Anna, after the then popular song. He used her for winkling and was a regular competitor in the race for bumkins at the West Mersea Town Regatta.

She passed to the Clarke family, and was working up until the early 1960’s. She was first restored by Peter Clarke, and then again in 2004 by Gerard Swift.
boat.name: Wheezy Anna

ownerships.note: First owner Jack Mole. she passed to the Clarke family. She was first restored by Peter Clarke and then again by Gerard Smith in 2004.
